climbs.name: Spunky Monkey
climbs.fa: Mark Rafferty, Ty Habbe, & John Lang

content.description: Follow the same start as "For What It's Worth." Traverse right and clip the bolt out right and swing under roof. Follow ramp under and around right of the roof into the steep crack. Fight the pump to the summit.
content.protection: 1 bolt, C4 #.3-#4, Doubles of .5, nuts    Bolted Anchor
content.location: The obvious roof to the right of PodnMe.

climbs.name: PodnMe
climbs.fa: Lane Smith & Mark Jacobs  1980 Ground Up

content.description: Climb the low-angle crack to gain the pod.  From the pod move up and over the bulge and enjoy the finger crack as it widens up.  Great finger locks get you through the roof and to a good chockstone at about 50'. Another 35' of hands gets you to a good flake and a rest where the crack widens up. 15' up a squeeze chimney and you're saved. Marginal feet - mostly smearing and camming. Steep and physical the whole way!
content.protection: Cams: .56-3.51, Nuts.     Descent: Needles rappel or down-climb off the backside.
content.location: Middle crack on the wall. The start is in on a grass ledge mid-way up the wall, behind the fin system.

climbs.name: Le Rêve
climbs.fa: Equip:Shannon Twomey FA:Harrison Teuber/belayed by Aaron Heiser 11/16/15

content.description: Le Rêve - 'The Dream' - Named and envisioned by Shannon Twomey.A really great rock climb that throws a little bit of everything at you.Start with some tricky face climbing to gain the crack. Fun climbing will bring you to a slightly runout and cryptic crux through the steep seam. (unless you're strong enough to place a small piece in the crux) The upper crack is great awkward flared climbing. Make a gray ghost placement at the top of the seam or run it out off a finger size cam through the slabby red-point crux.
content.protection: Gray c3- #2c4. Nuts/rps   2 bolts   2 bolt chain anchor
content.location: 2 bolts to obvious crack   Listed as an open project in the busse/burr guidebook

climbs.name: For What It's Worth
climbs.fa: Mark Rafferty & Jake Mader, 7/8/17 Ground Up

content.description: A fun yet spicy climb. Follow the wave like fin up and left with some insecure jams. Make sure to look for your placements. They are all there just have to find it. Route is a little dirty down low but quality increases as you get higher. Single rope rappel.
content.location: This is the next crack system to the right of PodnMe.

content.description: A very cool hard boulder start through 3 bolts leads to a series of cracks,another bolt an some flared crack water groves - protect when you get the opportunity-save a #1 or 2 cam for the top. Clip the last bolt and gun for the overhanging hand crack! Whats in a name? While Toby Brusseau was trying the for the second accent he had to try the crux crimp multiple times leaving blood on the beautiful green head wall. Having a tenacious spirit he did pull the move! Hopefully you will not be singing the chorus "Over & over"
content.protection: 5 bolts- .3-#2 Cammalot-stoppers- 2'runners   Two bolt chain anchor
content.location: This route is about twenty feet to the climbers left of Le Reve'

content.description: This is the wall of 101 cracks.
